Article_Name: Killed 5 "Saboteurs" Who Crossed From Ukraine: Russian Army
News Info: The Russian military said Monday that it had killed five "saboteurs" who crossed from Ukrainian territory, the latest claim fuelling tensions along Moscow's border with Ukraine.

Article_Name: Voting Figures In Punjab Erratic, Big Drop In Areas That Chose AAP
News Info: Voting figures in Punjab this time has turned out to be a mammoth 4.3 per cent more than the tentative figures announced by the Election Commission at 5 pm yesterday.

Article_Name: Akhilesh Yadav Wears Specs To See Religion, Caste Separately: Amit Shah
News Info: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday slammed Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav saying that he wears spectacles through which he sees religion and caste separately.

Article_Name: Two Band Artists Die Of Electrocution In Haryana: Police
News Info: Two band artists died of electrocution in the Tigaon area in Haryana's Faridabad, police said on Monday.

Article_Name: Biological E's Corbevax Is Second Covid Vaccine For Children In India
News Info: A second COVID-19 vaccine for children has received emergency use authorisation in India. Biological E Ltd's Corbevax has got EUA for children and teens between 12 and 18 years, the vaccine-maker said in a statement today.

Article_Name: Campaigning For UP Polls Phase 4 Ends, 624 Candidates Vie For 59 Seats
News Info: The high-stakes campaigning for the fourth phase of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections came to an end on Monday with leaders from various political parties intensifying attacks on their opponents.

Article_Name: Odisha Registers 78.6% In Third Phase Of Local Body Elections
News Info: A total of 78.6 per cent of 56.53 lakh voters have exercised their franchise in the third phase of Odisha panchayat polls, an SEC official said on Monday.

Article_Name: Timeline: Russia's Worrying Stand-Off With Ukraine
News Info: Russia's massing of troops along the border with Ukraine has put Washington and Moscow into an increasingly tense Cold War-style stand-off.
Mumbai International Airport has hired a group of banks to arrange a sale of US dollar-denominated bonds to refinance existing debt and for capital expenditure, a bank document showed on Monday.

Article_Name: After Teen's Decomposed Body Found In Delhi Shop, 1 Arrested For Gang Rape, Murder
News Info: Within 48 hours of procuring initial leads, Outer North District Police solved the gang rape and murder case of a Delhi girl and arrested one of the accused, informed Brijendra Kumar Yadav, the Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP) on Monday.

Article_Name: "Hijab Not An Essential Religious Practice": Karnataka Government Reiterates In Court
News Info: The AG quoted from four previous judgments to argue that issues like dress or food cannot be regarded as part of essential religious practices, and a pragmatic approach should be taken.

Article_Name: "Frozen Penis": Finnish Skier Shares Harrowing Winter Olympics Story
News Info: Cross-country skier Remi Lindholm had a rather uncomfortable time while racing in the 50-km mass start event at the Beijing Games. Though race was shortened to 30 km, situation did not help the skier from Finland - a sensitive body part had frozen.

Article_Name: Man Vows To Double Couple's Money Via Rituals, Robs Them During Mantra
News Info: A Thane resident was cheated of Rs 1 lakh by a person who promised to double the amount after conducting some rituals, police said on Monday.

Article_Name: Asked To State Stand On Marital Rape, Centre Seeks Time. Court Refuses
News Info: The Delhi High Court Monday refused to grant further time to the Centre to make its stand clear on the issue of criminalising marital rape and reserved judgement on various pleas in the matter.

Article_Name: Lalu Yadav Targeted Because He Refused To Shake Hands With BJP, Says Son
News Info: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Tejashwi Yadav claimed his father was targeted because he refused to shake hands with the BJP after a CBI court sentenced ex Bihar Chief Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav to five years jail in his fifth fodder scam case.
